title: How to Do Chevron Nails

steps.headline: Paint your nails.
steps.description: You can paint your nails all one color or use a couple of different colors. Make sure that you let your nails dry all the way before you apply the tape strips.

steps.headline: Dispense tape and cut into approximately 1” strips.
steps.description: It is up to you if you want to cut enough tape strips to make a chevron design on each of your nails or just do a couple. Make sure that the tape strips will completely cover the width of each of your nails. Attach the strips to the edge of a table by pressing a corner of the tape onto the bottom of the table's edge, just don’t press too hard.

steps.headline: Cut the tape into thin zigzagged strips.
steps.description: Use the pinking shears to cut each 1” strip of tape into a thin zigzagged strip. Cut along the long edges of the tape to make each strip. Apply the strips to your nails as you make them or reattach the strips to the table's edge until you are ready to use them.

steps.headline: Apply tape strips to your nails.
steps.description: Remove each piece of tape from the edge of the table and apply it across the width of each of your nails. Press the tape onto your nails and into the edge of your nails near your cuticle so that you can make the chevron design go all the way across your nails.

steps.headline: Paint over the tape with a different color of nail polish.
steps.description: Use a second color of nail polish to paint over your entire nail and the tape. Make sure that the second coat is thick enough to completely cover the first color. Do not allow the second coat to dry before you remove the tape.

steps.headline: Remove tape strips.
steps.description: Pull the tape strips off from your nails. Begin by pulling at the edges of the tape and  continue to pull until you have removed the tape strip . Make sure that you pull off the tape while your nails are still wet. You may want to only do one fingernail at a time to make sure the polish doesn’t dry. Make sure that you pull off the tape while your nails are still wet. You may want to only do one fingernail at a time to make sure the polish doesn’t dry.

steps.headline: Apply a clear top coat.
steps.description: After you have removed the strips, paint over your entire nail with a clear top coat. Let the polish dry all the way before doing anything that might mess up your nails.

tyn: two or three bottles of nail polish (your choice of color)
one bottle of clear nail polish
